content:
The cost of the school lunch program in Texas varies and depends on several factors, including the number of participating schools and students, the cost of food and supplies, and the funding received from the federal government.

The National School Lunch Program (NSLP), which operates in Texas and other states, is a federally assisted meal program that provides nutritionally balanced, low-cost or free lunches to children from low-income families. The program is funded through a combination of federal and state funds, as well as contributions from participating schools and local communities.

It is difficult to estimate the total cost of the school lunch program in Texas, as this can change from year to year and may vary by district. However, in the 2019-2020 school year, the NSLP served over 30 million lunches in Texas, with an average cost of $3.00 per lunch. Based on these numbers, the total cost of the program in Texas could be in the hundreds of millions of dollars.

It's worth noting that the NSLP is just one of several federal food assistance programs that operate in Texas and provide meals to children from low-income families. The total cost of these programs, including the NSLP, would be higher.
